keyMoments.title: Ohm Confronts Chopper
keyMoments.description: Ohm reveals himself to Chopper, recognizing him through Mantra as the one who defeated Gedatsu, and prepares to eliminate him in the Ordeal of Iron.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Ohm's awareness of the Straw Hats' progress and his role as one of the most formidable priests.
keyMoments.quote: I know you defeated Gedatsu through my Mantra. You are the third to reach this place.

keyMoments.title: Demonstrates the Eisen Whip
keyMoments.description: Ohm showcases his signature weapon's versatility, freely manipulating the Iron Cloud blade to create various deadly attacks.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the Eisen Whip as one of the most unique and dangerous weapons in the Skypiea arc.

keyMoments.title: Defeats Chopper
keyMoments.description: Ohm overwhelms Chopper with his superior skill and defeats him, declaring a 0% survival rate for the Ordeal of Iron.
keyMoments.significance: Proves Ohm's claim about his ordeal's lethality and sets up the need for stronger fighters to defeat him.
keyMoments.quote: The Ordeal of Iron has a 0% survival rate. Not one of you will escape.

keyMoments.title: Blocks Wyper's Path
keyMoments.description: Ohm confronts Wyper at Giant Jack, preventing him from ascending to God's Shrine and demonstrating his role as guardian of Enel's domain.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the conflict between multiple factions converging at the Upper Ruins.
keyMoments.quote: Who gave you permission to climb to God's Shrine?

abilities.description: Allows Ohm to sense opponents' positions and predict their movements.
A sword with an Iron Cloud blade that can freely change shape, length, and width for versatile attacks.
Forms a solid Iron Cloud wall to block opponent's attacks.
Shapes the Eisen Whip blade into a fan-like configuration for wide-range attacks.

relationships.description: Holy is Ohm's trained combat dog who fights alongside him in battles.

evolutionMoments.description: Holy assists Ohm in confronting Chopper at the Upper Ruins.

relationships.description: Ohm serves as one of Enel's four priests, guarding Upper Yard with the Ordeal of Iron.

reveals.information: Demonstrates full versatility of the Eisen Whip weapon system
Believes that attachment to life is an earthly desire that must be purged

keyMoments.title: Encounters Chopper
keyMoments.description: Holy approaches Chopper but is commanded by Ohm to stop, demonstrating his obedience and training.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Holy's role as Ohm's combat companion and his well-trained nature.

abilities.description: Holy is trained in boxing techniques and can fight using his paws.
Holy is extremely obedient to verbal commands, following orders from anyone who gives them.

relationships.description: Holy serves as Ohm's trained combat dog and loyal companion.

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Arrives at the Upper Ruins
keyMoments.description: Chopper reaches the ancient ruins seeking treasure, excited about potentially finding gold for his crew.
keyMoments.significance: Marks Chopper's arrival at a crucial battleground.
keyMoments.quote: I found the ruins! There must be gold here somewhere!

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Ohm
keyMoments.description: Despite his efforts, Chopper is overwhelmed by Ohm's superior skill and the deadly Ordeal of Iron.
keyMoments.significance: One of Chopper's most decisive defeats, highlighting the power gap with the priests.

keyMoments.title: Carried by South Bird
keyMoments.description: The giant South Bird grabs Zoro and carries him through the sky before dropping him at the Upper Ruins.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's directional challenges while inadvertently bringing him to his destination.
keyMoments.quote: Let me down now or I'll clip your wings!

keyMoments.title: Crashes at the Upper Ruins
keyMoments.description: Zoro crash-lands at the Upper Ruins, accidentally arriving at his intended destination despite his terrible sense of direction.
keyMoments.significance: Brings one of the Straw Hats' strongest fighters to confront Ohm.
keyMoments.quote: Where am I now? Wait, are these the ruins? And there's gold here!

keyMoments.title: Reaches Giant Jack
keyMoments.description: Wyper arrives at the base of Giant Jack, declaring his intention to climb to the top and confront Enel to end 400 years of suffering.
keyMoments.significance: Represents the Shandians' centuries-old quest for justice and homeland.
keyMoments.quote: Enel is at the top of Giant Jack. It's time to bring an end to 400 years of hardship!

keyMoments.title: Arrives with News About God's Shrine
keyMoments.description: Gan Fall informs Wyper that he just returned from God's Shrine and that it has been completely destroyed with Enel absent.
keyMoments.significance: Changes the tactical situation by revealing Enel is not at his expected location.
keyMoments.quote: I just returned from God's Shrine. The place has been completely destroyed, and Enel is not there.

keyMoments.title: Chased by Nola
keyMoments.description: Nami and Aisa flee on a waver as the rampaging Nola pursues them into the forest.
keyMoments.significance: Forces Nami deeper into danger on Upper Yard.

keyMoments.title: Uses Mantra to Sense Danger
keyMoments.description: Aisa uses her natural Mantra ability to sense Nola approaching and warns Nami.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Aisa's innate Observation Haki abilities.
keyMoments.quote: The giant snake is coming! I can sense it with my Mantra!

abilities.description: Aisa was born with the ability to use Observation Haki, allowing her to sense when people die or lose consciousness.

keyMoments.title: Trapped Inside Nola
keyMoments.description: Luffy continues to explore what he thinks is a cave, unaware he's inside the giant python Nola.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the comedic revelation and future confrontation.
keyMoments.quote: This must be a trick door! If I break through it, I should find a way out!

keyMoments.title: Causes Nola to Rampage
keyMoments.description: Luffy's attacks from inside Nola cause the giant python to thrash wildly and rampage through Upper Yard.
keyMoments.significance: Luffy's actions inadvertently affect the battles happening outside.

keyMoments.title: Explores Shandora's Ruins
keyMoments.description: Robin investigates the ancient city's ruins, noting discrepancies in building locations due to the impact that sent the island skyward.
keyMoments.significance: Advances Robin's search for historical truth and the Poneglyph.
keyMoments.quote: The building locations don't match the map. The impact that sent this island into the sky must have shifted everything.
